Chapter 6, Part 7 on Contemplating the Heavens, Part 4 on the Thirty-three Celestials
Next, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and contemplate the abodes of the thirty-three celestials.
They see with the wisdom of hearing:
The thirty-third heaven is called 'Leaving Dangerous Shores.'
What karma causes beings to be born there?
What they hear, know, and see is this:
If a person upholds the precepts, benefits beings, and perfumesthe mind with merit and virtue, or if a virtuous person upholds the precepts and wisdom, or if they give a single meal to a sick person,
they themselves do not kill:

If there are insects, ants, or various small creatures in an empty tree, or if various cattle, sheep, elephants, horses, camels, or donkeys are released, or if a fire is set in the wilderness during the cold winter months due to ice, snow, or frost, if a good person extinguishes the burning fire with water or earth, sees it being done and dissuades it, does not intentionally do it himself, even if he does it he repents, does not rejoice, and explains the terrors to him, causing him to abide in good dharmas.
Causing those beings to abide in good dharmas, not stealing himself and not teaching others to do so.
Such a person, upon the end of their life, is born in the Heaven of Safe Shore.

The ground is filled with gold, silver, and various red jewels. In this way, various gold, silver, and mixed jewels are used to adorn the various karmic fruits. Various jewels are used to fill various places, and various jeweled trees are used for adornment. Various birds and beasts adorn the ground. Everywhere there are various kinds of birds and beasts covering the dangerous cliffs. All the gardens and forests are adorned with innumerable seven treasures.

The gods of Separated from Danger live in this forest. Their adornments are like a mass of molten gold. They are surrounded by hundreds of thousands of celestial maidens and experience the pleasures of the five desires.
Wherever they stay, their bodies emit light. The light of the shore trees is also like the bodies of the gods. They play and enjoy themselves in this forest.

Together with the celestial maidens, they go to the river forest. On both banks of the river, there are many golden trees, with golden leaves. The light of the trees makes the water yellow, without any white color.
The current is swift, so no white color is seen.
In the gardens and forests, the gods and goddesses play and enjoy themselves.
The gods think:
'Now this tree should produce delicious drinks.'
Due to their good karma, as soon as they think of it, various delicious drinks flow out, with perfect color, aroma, and flavor. They drink from jeweled vessels.
They drink heavenly flavors and experience heavenly bliss.
Seeing the goddesses, they are burned by the fire of desire, but because of their pleasure, they do not realize it.
The gods further think:
'I now wish to hear various sounds.'
Due to their good karma, as soon as they think of it, the wind moves the trees and produces wonderful sounds, surpassing the sounds of the five musical instruments.
The gods further think:
'Now this tree should produce the flavor of sudha.'

Due to their wholesome karma, whatever they think of will immediately appear on the trees, like a large vessel pouring out its contents, flowing down from above, with a taste of rock candy that cannot be compared.

The celestial beings eat it, sing various wonderful tunes, go to the jeweled ground, gaze at it intently, always delighting in desire, and experience the pleasures of the five desires in the jeweled ground.

Having left that ground, they go to the universal grove, in which there are seven kinds of birds: golden geese made of true gold and the seven treasures, blue parrots made of indra blue, mandarin ducks made of chita red treasure, ducks made of lapis lazuli, peacocks made of blue treasure and cat's eye, myna birds made of great blue and the seven treasures, and kalaviá¹…ka birds made of coral and silver treasure.

Their beautiful voices are like the sounds of the peacock bird, pleasing to the ears of the multitude. They soar in the sky, playing and amusing themselves. Their beautiful sounds are like the voices of celestial maidens.
In the lotus ponds, the birds are adorned with various bees and play within. They also soar and play on land.

There are also golden trees with various leaves and shadows adorning the birds' bodies. When the gods see the birds, they give rise to joyful minds, and hearing their sounds, their minds and thoughts are delighted.
The gods travel through the sky and play with the birds, sometimes playing with the birds in the water, and sometimes playing with the birds on land.
In this way, the gods play with the birds, and the gods and goddesses entertain each other. The male and female birds also play and enjoy themselves.
The bhiká¹£us observe the birds enjoying heavenly pleasures and speak a verse, saying:
The animals engage in desire, created by the power of delusion. If the gods are like this,
they are no different from animals.
Humans enjoy wealth and pleasure, but are not attached to indulgence. This is a wise person. The foolish are the opposite.
Carelessness will lead the gods to hell, as the wise have said, carelessness is like poison.
Foolish and careless, attached to present pleasures, the fruits of carelessness will ripen,
and later great regret will arise.
Contemplate carelessness, there is not the slightest benefit. If one abandons carelessness, one will always be free from worry and distress.
Carelessness is great suffering, non-carelessness is happiness. To summarize, one should abandon carelessness.
If a person loves suffering, they should practice carelessness. If one happily practices carelessness,
in the end there will be no happy retribution.
Happy is non-carelessness, leading to a place of non-retrogression. Not practicing carelessness, one will always be free from the retribution of suffering.
These heavenly multitudes, playing with the birds, gods and animals, are equal, without distinction.
The realms, paths, bodies, and minds, all perish. Gods, humans, and non-humans,
The hells and hungry ghosts.
The various divisions of karma are also like this. With various mixed karmas,
One is born among the gods, attached to indulgence, unaware of decline.
When the signs of death arrive, you will know for yourself that you will fall from the heavens,
And experience great suffering.
Ruined by delusion, deceived by indulgence, the gods are thirsty and fall into hell.
Deceived by play and pleasure, they fall into hell, having experienced heavenly bliss, they will later experience great suffering.
Confused by the mind, they do not detest birth and death;
Deceived by craving, they go from suffering to suffering.'
The bhiká¹£us thus reprimanded the indulgent gods with these verses, greedy for the five desires, not knowing contentment, like fire getting fuel.
Until the good karma of love is exhausted, they will fall from the heavens and, following karma, be reborn in hell, the realm of hungry ghosts, or the realm of animals.

If they have good karma, they will be reborn among humans, always experiencing comfort and happiness, with abundant food and drink, in a prosperous country with abundant harvests, perhaps as a king or a minister.
This is due to remaining karma.
Next, the bhiká¹£us, knowing the fruits of karma, contemplate the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with the wisdom of hearing:
The Thirty-three Celestials have a twelfth place called Valley Cliff Shore.
What kind of karma do sentient beings have to be reborn in that heaven?
They hear, know, and see:
If a person, with a good mind, practices merit and gives to those who have attained the first dhyÄna,
giving them food themselves, teaching others to give food, rejoicing in giving, and teaching others to rejoice, this is called giving.
Not killing, not stealing:
If people are traveling and there are wells, springs, ponds, or streams where water is provided, they provide them with bottles, jars, and drinking vessels to supply travelers.
There are also other people who teach others to steal and take them across the wilderness:
'If you do not take, you will certainly die of thirst.'

At that time, although that person knows they will die of thirst, out of fear of committing a crime, they do not accept the teaching, do not steal the property, do not rejoice in it, encourage others not to take it, and make them abide in the good path, even to the point of losing their life, they do not commit theft.
What is meant by not killing?
One personally abstains from killing, encourages others to abstain from killing, and denounces the practice of killing.

If there are tiny insects in the windows, doors, or roof beams of a house, or if one is afraid of injuring their lives when lighting a fire, one does not close the windows or doors. This is called not killing.
One also teaches others to practice not killing and abide in the good path.
Such a person, upon the end of their life, will be born in the Heaven of the Cliff's Edge in the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials, to experience the rewards of good karma.

There is a forest called Low in Accordance with the Season, in which various jewels shine with light, and blue lapis lazuli is pure and spotless. Various birds sing wonderful songs, the flowers are always in bloom, and flowing streams and ponds serve as adornments. Blue lapis lazuli is used as lotus flowers, and the golden peaks are like molten gold.
Birds of various colors play within, either in the water, on land, or on mountain peaks, steep cliffs, and mountain caves, emitting wonderful sounds.
Transformed by good karma, they experience the fruits of good karma.

Surrounded by various celestial maidens, adorned with celestial garlands and celestial garments, with exceptional and sublime physical characteristics, majestic virtues, and splendor, they sing and dance in this forest.
Due to good karma, the celestial birds in the forest sing a verse, saying:
The sentient beings who create good karma will experience heavenly bliss;
If they create unwholesome karma, they will suffer the consequences in hell.
Having been born in the heavens, they are able to awaken themselves,
From pleasure they attain blissful results, not being deluded by craving.
The rope of karma binds sentient beings, keeping them long in the prison of the three realms,
The power of karma turns freely, like the hub turning the many spokes.
Revolving in the three realms, in the eight directions and above and below,
Blown by the wind of karmic power, like dust wandering in the sky.
Born from causes and conditions, like a lotus flower ornament,
Such heavenly adornments all arise from wholesome karma.
Just as clear and pure water, like the sky free from dust,
Such a pure mind can reach a place of peace and bliss.
The person liberated from the three bonds, who can guard the five faculties,
Those who are far from the Dharma of one person, will experience bliss in the heavens.
Those who are shameless and have no sense of shame, are unruly and bad friends,
Like poison and also like fire, the wise should abandon them.
Those who speak truthfully and practice generosity, should always delight in being close to them,
Always having a compassionate mind towards sentient beings, this path leads to rebirth in the heavens.
With a sincere mind, not deceitful or crooked, practicing generosity and cultivating right mindfulness,
By these causes of one's own karma, one will be reborn in these heavens.
All life in the world, is due to Dharma and non-Dharma,
There is no better protection than the Dharma, therefore one should practice the Dharma.
If a person abandons the Dharma, delights in practicing unwholesome actions,
Will be burned by evil, and experience suffering without end.
Having already been reborn in the heavens, if one indulges in a careless mind,
That person's wholesome karma will be exhausted, and upon retrogression, one will then become aware.
Ultimate happiness is supreme, without birth and also without death,
The net of death binds sentient beings, without a place of peace and happiness.
Following the place of receiving happiness, the mind of love grows more and more,
The fire of love burns sentient beings, and they receive the suffering retribution of hell.
Do not act carelessly, it is not appropriate for the gods,
Carelessness is destroyed by faults, and one loses the heavenly realm.

' When the heavenly birds spoke this Dharma, the minds of the heavenly beings were confused, thinking of the heavenly maidens. They did not listen to or accept the beneficial Dharma. Thirsty for the five desires, their minds were attached. They joyfully received pleasures while playing in the lotus ponds.
They then went to a mountain peak called the Mountain Peak of Joyful Play. There were birds called playful ones, playing and amusing each other in the ponds.
At that time, the gods saw the birds and had this thought:
'How wonderful!
The various colors and sounds of this bird surpass all other birds.
' At that time, the celestial son had another thought:
'I will now ride this bird to observe the forests and ponds.'

As soon as the celestial son had this thought, the bird's body immediately transformed into a larger size. The celestial son then touched it with his hand and rode it through the sky, soaring and enjoying himself.

The celestial son further thought of transforming a seven-jeweled palace on the bird's back, complete with gardens, forests, and flower ponds, adorned with various birds. Riding it through the sky, he and the celestial maidens, adorned in various ways, played everywhere and enjoyed various pleasures, observing the abodes of the various celestials.
Having observed them, his attachment increased a hundred thousand times, incomparable.
Such a fire of desire, burning with the six desires, is uncontrollable. Mistaking delusion and attachment for pleasure is actually great suffering.
Riding birds through the sky, with the sounds of the five kinds of music and songs, the sounds are beautiful and wonderful, beyond comparison.

Everywhere they see the celestial sons and celestial maidens on Mount Sumeru, the gardens, forests, ponds, streams, mountain valleys, trees, and lotuses covering everywhere, with many birds, all of which they see.
In each dwelling place, there are countless hundreds of thousands of gods residing, and they look everywhere without ever tiring of it.
Their faculties are attached and greedy for the five desires, joyfully without satiation, and their loving minds grow.

In this way, for a long time they play and amuse themselves riding birds, observing the sixty thousand mountains surrounding Mount Sumeru, the abodes of the gods with good karma, adorned with countless precious flames and light, extremely delightful.
The four sides of Mount Sumeru have four colors, namely the colors of lapis lazuli, white silver, gold, and crystal.
This god roams everywhere, observing Mount Sumeru, riding in a bird-drawn palace back to his abode. When he arrives at his dwelling place, it is adorned with the colors and forms as the gods wish.
At that time, the god-son again rides in a bird-drawn palace to the MÄtá¹›pÅ«rá¹‡a Pond. The pond is five yojanas in circumference, adorned with various blue lapis lazuli lotuses.

The bird arrives at this pond and, together with the celestial maidens, enjoys the five desires and pleasures. Like a swarm of bees greedily enjoying the taste of flowers, it drinks the mÄtu wine and eats the suta flavor, which is endowed with color, fragrance, and taste. Wearing celestial jeweled garments, it plays and enjoys pleasures with the celestial maidens.
Until the good karma of love is exhausted, it will die from the heavens and, following karma, transmigrate and fall into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals.

If there is good karma, it will be reborn among humans, always experiencing wealth and happiness, with many places for riding and playing. It may become a king or a minister, respected and loved by the people.
due to other karmic causes.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and observe the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
The thirteenth ground is called the Jewel Treasury.
What karma do sentient beings have to be born in this heaven?
They hear, know, and see:

If there are good people who benefit sentient beings, do not kill or steal, and also teach others to abide in the good path, themselves not killing, up to seeing insects born from moisture in wine and honey, if they do not filter and purify it, they will never drink it on purpose.

They do not teach others to do so, nor do they rejoice in it. Knowing that unwholesome karma, they abandon it and do not create it. Seeing others do evil, they abandon it and do not associate with them. Encouraging them to cultivate goodness, this is called not killing.
What is meant by not stealing?

Even when entering a temple, if there is a lamp offering to the Buddha's pagoda, they do not use its light for various tasks, nor do they take its smoke as ink for writing. They fear even the slightest offense. This is called not stealing.
Furthermore, there is not killing and not stealing:
As for not killing, they do not harm even mosquitoes and ants that irritate people, do not think of killing, and if they see others killing, they encourage them to let go. They tell those people:
If one kills, this is an unwholesome karma. Upon death, one will fall into the AvÄ«ci Hell.
In this way, they teach others to not do evil and abide in wholesome dharmas.
Such good people themselves uphold the precepts and cause others to abide in the precepts.
If traveling through a wilderness or a famine-stricken world, they give food and drink.
If they are hungry and in distress, they do not steal others' food.
In the wilderness, to the poor, hungry, and destitute who lack food, they can reduce their own food to give to the poor.
Because of the superiority of both their thoughts and the field of blessings, they attain great rewards, because they give at the right time.
Why is this?
The greatest illness is none other than hunger and famine. Therefore, giving food attains great rewards.

Thus, these two kinds of people who uphold the precepts benefit themselves and others, have a good and upright mind, are the foremost good people, and even for minor offenses, they always have great fear. They give precious jewels to their parents, or give jeweled necklaces to the TathÄgata's image.
When these people's lives end, they are born in the heaven of the thirty-three celestials, in the ground of maá¹‡i treasures.
Having been born in that heaven, they experience the foremost bliss and amuse themselves with the five desires.

The radiance and splendor of these people of good karma universally illuminates five hundred yojanas. It is like the sun rising and universally illuminating the myriad mountains. The radiance of this celestial illuminates all the grounds in the same way.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
The ground of various treasures was originally endowed with light, and when the light of the celestial beings shone upon it, it became a hundred times more splendid.
The light was blue, yellow, vermilion, and purple, like the colors of a rainbow, and the light of their bodies became a hundred times more splendid, with extraordinary adornments.
Due to their good karma, their bodies were like lightning, surpassing the celestial beings.
Just as the moon is the foremost among the stars, so was the body of this celestial being.

The flames of light all over his body illuminated the jeweled ground, which was adorned with various maá¹‡i jewels, intricately inlaid with distinct patterns, and all the light was like a hundred suns shining simultaneously.
When the celestial being saw this, he was overjoyed.

He further observed other places and saw celestial maidens with perfect beauty, adorned with various jewels beyond comparison, enjoying various pleasures, playing music with drums, strings, flutes, reed pipes, and lutes, singing various wonderful songs with such sounds.
Some danced and played, adorned with heavenly garlands, some played with birds in flower ponds, and some ate heavenly fruits.
They also took flowers and fruits from wish-fulfilling trees, singing songs of desire and music to delight the assembly.
When the heavenly sons arrived, they saw the heavenly maidens bitten by the evil snakes of the objects of desire. They turned their seats to face the heavenly maidens.
The heavenly maidens were adorned with heavenly garlands. When the heavenly sons saw this, their hearts burned with the fire of desire, and they turned to look at the heavenly maidens.

At that time, when the heavenly maidens saw that their husbands were about to die, the five signs of death appeared. Just as a swarm of bees abandons a withered flower to go to a newly blooming flower,
the heavenly maidens also abandoned their former lovers and flocked to the heavenly sons in the same way.
Adorned with various heavenly garlands and various heavenly garments, they entertained the heavenly sons with thoughts of desire, delighting their minds.
This fallen god, from beginningless time, has been accustomed to indulging in desires. Seeing the celestial maidens turn their backs and go elsewhere, his mind becomes agitated.
Just like the raging fires of AvÄ«ci Hell burning his body, seeing the celestial maidens turn their backs on him and go to others, his mind is greatly agitated in the same way.

Falling from the heavens, with a mind of jealousy he harms his own body. When the retribution is about to end, grasping at the turbid mind of conditions, seeing nothing else, he falls into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals.
For what reasons does he see the celestial maidens turn their backs and go elsewhere, giving rise to great suffering?
In his previous life as a human, he engaged in deviant conduct and violated the wives of others.
Because of creating good karma, he was born among the gods, but because he violated others' wives, he sees this evil karma.
Thus, within good karma, evil karma matures. Therefore, even the slightest evil karma should not be done.
If one is able to uphold the seven kinds of precepts without deficiency or leakage, then there will be remaining fruits.
The YÄma Heaven gods do not see such signs of decline, and the karmic retribution in the future is briefly explained without further elaboration.
The celestial maidens, adorned with celestial garlands, quickly go to the newly born god and offer him celestial garlands to adorn him.
The garlands of flowers have complete color, fragrance, and are not withered, and they make the newly born god wear these flower garlands.
When the god puts them on, he is delighted and immediately becomes intimate with them, playing and enjoying each other in the gardens and forests.
In this place where the gods reside, they see pure water, lapis lazuli flowers, with golden leaves and diamond pistils, surrounded by hundreds of thousands of bees.

Some bees have wings of genuine gold, bodies of lapis lazuli, wings of white silver, bodies of genuine gold, wings of red jewels, bodies of various colors, and wings of coral. They always play and enjoy themselves in such an undegenerated and unchanging lotus pond, their voices as clear and wonderful as the voices of heavenly maidens.
Such bees adorn the place.
The heavenly sons and heavenly maidens enter the lotus pond to play and enjoy themselves, singing, laughing, and playing for a long time in the pond.
They then go to the forest of golden garland trees, which cover the two trees.

Having arrived in the forest, various kinds of music emits wonderful sounds. They see Mount Sumeru's peak like a mass of molten gold, and see the heavenly multitudes on the mountain peak amusing themselves with heavenly maidens and music, adorned with heavenly garlands and heavenly garments, and their bodies adorned with ornaments of JambÅ«nada gold.
In the lotus ponds and utpala ponds, various fragrances are all complete. The gods and goddesses play and enjoy themselves.
Geese, ducks, and mandarin ducks, and powerful lions all line up. The gods play and enjoy themselves in the middle.

They also see the gods traveling in the sky with the goddesses like bright lamps, singing beautiful songs to entertain themselves, raining various wonderful flowers, enjoying heavenly pleasures, and amusing themselves with the sounds of the five musical instruments.
They also see the gods drinking heavenly delicacies without getting drunk, each speaking affectionate words to entertain each other, making their minds joyful.
They also see the gods eating sudhÄ, the fruits of their own good karma, complete with color, fragrance, taste, and touch.
They also see the gods picking seven-treasure flowers from the seven-treasure trees to adorn themselves.
He also sees the heavenly beings picking flowers and fruits, some eating them, some throwing them at each other as a joke, and enjoying themselves together.
He further sees the heavenly beings riding heavenly birds, adorned with various seven treasures, riding these geese and birds in the sky, playing with each other.

He also sees the heavenly beings singing and playing music, with the heavenly maidens dancing and entertaining in front of the celestial sons, playfully throwing heavenly lotus flowers at each other, speaking flirtatiously and indulging in love.
The newly born celestial son sees these various heavenly beings and various karmic manifestations, and thinks to himself:
'Although I see these, my eyes are never satisfied.
Hearing various sounds, my ears are never tired of them.
Various fragrances, my nose is also like this.
Various six flavors, my tongue is never satisfied.
The body craves fine textures, heavenly garments, exquisite robes, and adorning the body with ointments, also like this, not knowing contentment.
All loved dharmas, the mind always follows along, I now love and enjoy, will receive this happiness.
Having contemplated like this, mutually loving and enjoying, like the heavens should experience the five desires and pleasures.
Thus the mind of the heavenly son is attached to the six loves, all the fires of love surround and burn.

It is like a person in the middle of a hot summer day, when it is extremely hot, walking in a wilderness, a great fire suddenly arises, burning all the dry grass, tree leaves, branches, mountain valleys, and forest trees, all the fires arise, frightened and fleeing, there is no place to escape;
The flames blaze, surrounding on all four sides, becoming a single flame burning all the forests, wherever it goes, smoke and flames arise together, being burned by the fire, unable to escape.
The foolish ordinary beings of the world are also like this, burned by the fire of love for dry grass and tree branches.
The person who creates karma in the heavens is blown by the wind of afflictions and delusion into the great fire of craving.
Cultivating meditation and contemplation, attaining worldly meditation, like a withered tree, mountain valley grass and leaves, burned by the fire of craving.
The fierce and blazing fire is a metaphor for the six kinds of craving.
Running around everywhere is a metaphor for being attached to objects through the various faculties.
The blazing flames recall objects, blown by a fierce wind, burned by the fire of craving, destroying the worlds of gods and humans.
The fire is a metaphor for the fire of craving.

Because of good karma in the heavens, one experiences immeasurable hundreds of thousands of pleasures, until the good karma of love is exhausted, one falls from the heavens and transmigrates according to karma, falling into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals.

If reborn among humans, they will dwell on jeweled grounds, adorned with all kinds of treasures, and be born into a family, either as a great king or a great minister, always experiencing bliss, loved by the people, with complete offspring, and abundant resources.
This is due to their remaining karma.
Furthermore, the bhiká¹£us know the fruits of karma and observe the abodes of the Thirty-three Celestials.
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
The fourteenth ground is called 'Revolving Movement.'
What karma causes sentient beings to be born in that ground?
They see with their wisdom of hearing:
There are sentient beings who do not kill or steal. Seeing others doing so, they encourage them not to do so, saying that unwholesome karma leads to bad consequences.
What does it mean not to kill?
Even for a vegetable leaf, if they see tiny insects in the water, they protect them and do not eat.
If the water is not filtered, they never drink it on purpose.
He filters water to avoid harming insects, does not discard them on dry land, but returns them to the water to ensure their safety and survival. He also teaches others to abide in the good path.
What is meant by not stealing?
If it is sugarcane fields, fruits, vegetables, or amla fruits, things belonging to others, he does not give rise to the thought of stealing, and also teaches others not to steal.
He himself upholds the precepts and teaches others to uphold the precepts.
What does it mean to uphold the precepts?
Not killing and not stealing.
Even to the point of losing one's life, one does not drink water with insects in it, nor does one use it, and also teaches others not to do so. This is called not killing living beings.
What is meant by not stealing?
Even a blade of grass, one does not intentionally steal.
One practices giving. If one sees a sick person, one gives them medicine to cure their illness and bring them comfort. One also does not use medicine that kills insects to treat others' illnesses.
This is good giving, and even up to nirvana, one's blessings are not exhausted.
When this person's life ends, they will be reborn in the revolving ground of the Heaven of the Thirty-three Celestials.
After being born there, due to their good karma, all kinds of precious jewels and lights will revolve, and excellent celestial maidens will make offerings to them.
After making offerings, they will go to the forest of light wheels, where there are various kinds of music. In the forest, there are birds called adorned trees that fill the forest.
By the power of the birds, they can go wherever they wish to go by flying in the sky, and the forest will also follow them.
If the celestial sons are under the trees, the forest will also follow them.
Wherever they go, lotus ponds will appear, filled with various kinds of lotus flowers as adornments, with leaves of lapis lazuli, stems of genuine gold, and pistils of white silver.
On the lotus pedestals, celestial maidens will sing various wonderful sounds.

Due to good karma, in the lotus flowers flow out mÄtá¹›mÄtá¹›, a kind of delicious drink, which the heavenly maidens drink. Together with the sons of heaven who dwell in the lotus flowers, the heavenly maidens surround them and drink mÄtá¹› together. After enjoying pleasures for a long time, they descend from the sky, following the birds, and together with the heavenly maidens, go to the Utpala Palace.
The palace is two yojanas long and wide. In this way, there are hundreds of thousands of utpala flowers. Each heavenly maiden dwells on the tip of a petal, singing, dancing, and playing music.

There are also blue utpala flowers. The blue light of the flowers makes all the heavenly maidens appear blue. If they are in red, it makes all the heavenly maidens appear red. Their bodily ornaments are also like this.

The heavenly sons and heavenly maidens sit on lotus pedestals. Due to their good karma, they are surrounded by heavenly maidens sitting on lotus stamens. They hold various colored jeweled banners in their hands, singing and dancing, and enjoy heavenly pleasures for a long time.

Descending from the flower pedestals, they see the palace called KechilÄra. There is a river called Lovely View, the banks of which are filled with jeweled trees with complete branches and leaves, trunks and stems. Various birds with well-proportioned beaks and wings sing with the sounds of parrots, adorning the river banks. Whatever the gods think of, it appears from the river.
The river is adorned with heavenly maidens singing and dancing, extremely delightful, and they entertain each other.
When the heavenly sons come to this delightful river, the heavenly maidens see them and all greatly rejoice, singing, dancing, laughing, and making various kinds of music.

Other celestial maidens will come playing various kinds of music. At that time, the celestial sons will see the celestial maidens' exquisite beauty and become a hundred times more attached to them. They will run to the celestial maidens and play with the celestial maidens of the blue lotus ponds on the riverbank.
All the celestial maidens will gather together, playing various kinds of music and producing wonderful sounds. The sound of their singing will fill the jeweled peak of Mount Sumeru.

At that time, all the celestial beings in the mountain peak will come to the gathering upon hearing this wonderful sound. Their minds and thoughts will be attached to the singing of the celestial maidens. The celestial sons and celestial maidens will gather together without jealousy, singing and dancing and playing.
They will then go to the pleasure groves and forests to enjoy countless hundreds of thousands of pleasures for a long time.
Until their good karmic actions are exhausted, they will die and transmigrate according to their karma, falling into the hells, hungry ghosts, or animals.

If reborn among humans, they will always experience peace and happiness, always enjoy bathing, anointing with fragrant ointments, and love various lotus flowers, blue lotus flowers, red lotus flowers, and white lotus flowers. They will be honest, wise, and love the true Dharma;
they may become a king, a minister, an elder, a city governor, or a guide;
